page.title: 09Clean Air in Coddenham
page.content: Pollution attacks in many forms but in Coddenham we are fortunate, being close to the North Sea with clean air and no industry. Noise, vibration and carbon monoxide are created by vehicles in the narrow roads built long ago for horses and carts but some heavy traffic from the east has been re-routed recently to by-pass the High Street giving a measure of relief. Agricultural tractors and machinery however, must use the roads incessantly in serving the many farms in the area. In this arable farming area, water supplies can be exposed to nitrate infiltration from crop fertilisers but our Water authority controls this and keeps the nitrate level in water, below that decreed by the European Council.
